My game is at around 10fps for some reason, does anyone else have this problem?  My PC is running two GTX580's in SLI, so don't say it's time to upgrade.

Got the freezing lag, low FPS thing sorted, you just need to disable your SLI in Nvidia Control Panel, it's no use setting the game to force single card, you have to totally disable the setting through the CP.  Hope this helps a few people.  Thanks for the Torrent, much appreciated.  Pitty it's just a c lone from the console with no Graphical improvement.

Okay...where to start?

First of all, the install notes are your best friend.  It literally tells you exactly what to do.  If you read it...everything USUALLY works out.

However, that was not the case this time.  I did everything exactly as the install notes directed, yet when I try to play the game, not only did I have to change compatibility mode to Windows XP (I'm running Windows 7) but I had to actually lower the graphics to get above 20 FPS.  To put this into perspective, I ran Crysis on this same laptop on high settings at 60 FPS.  But that's not even the worst part.  I can deal with 20 FPS, that's not that bad.  What I can't deal with, is when you lower the graphics, the textures get COMPLETELY FUCKED UP.  It gives you a total of eight options to lower, none of them dealing with textures, if I recall correctly.  Anyways, it's still playable, but only if you're a desperate fanboy.  Uninstalled this piece after only 11 minutes of screwing around with the options and then giving up.

Hey guys. 
So I followed the notes to the point, blocking out the game in my firewall. 
The thing is that I already had Uplay installed since I bought some original games from Ubisoft.
I clicked the Trials FMX, and the game popped it in my Uplay account.
The problem is that it's asking for a CD - Key.
Help?

Fixed the problem.
For all those getting the CD - Key thing, here's what to do:
Find the TrialsFMX file
Right click and go to properties
Go on compatibility
Select to run it on Vista service pack 2
Apply and Ok
Now double click the TrialsFMX file, and it should work :)
